subject: Re: Thou shalt not always write isolated tests (was: [junit] Re: Expected exception pitfall and pattern)
msgSnippet: ... I think this is possible, but it won t provide a completion solution, thanks to reflection. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info Your
messageBody:
Eugene Kuleshov wrote:

> Technically information you are hardcoding into your test hierarchy
> can be obtained automatically and test runner can reorganize test cases
> based on dependencies using quite simple static code analysis. Hey,
> anyone would like to implement this idea?! :-)

I think this is possible, but it won't provide a completion solution,
thanks to reflection.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
